title: Commitment Conservation in Neural Compression Systems (v0.03 - Empirical Validation)
description: This release presents empirical validation of commitment conservation principles in neural compression systems. Key findings: baseline systems exhibit 20% stability (4/5 signals show catastrophic semantic drift), while enforced systems achieve 60% stability (3x improvement). The 40 percentage point gap empirically validates the architectural framework. Simple enforcement (extract commitments → compress → check preservation → append if missing) triples stability, proving the theoretical principle operationalizes effectively.
notes: Experimental results show 40pp stability improvement with simple enforcement. Baseline: 20% avg stability (0.638 fidelity). Enforced: 60% avg stability (0.789 fidelity). Tested across 5 signals with 10 recursive iterations. Full experimental data available in repository outputs/.

improvement.key_finding: Simple enforcement triples stability, validating conservation framework
